content: YouTrip Credit Card Asked by AnonymousAsked on 11 Jun 2019Which is the best credit card to use for youtrip topup?Are there any perks if I were to use a specific card to do YouTrip topups? e.g miles or cashback etc5 answersAnswerBump3
Answers (5)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

NNNicholas NbxLevel 2. RookieUpdated on 23 Aug 2019So far I saw YouTrip is specifically excluded from Citibank and UOB card. But it worked for Standard Chartered Unlimited Cashback. I've tried and gotten 1.5% cashback on all my YouTrip top-ups with that card, at least at the of time of this post. Hope it helps!0 comments1

Clarence Chua, Financial Planning Specialist at Prudential Assurance SingaporeTop Contributor (Sep)Level 7. Grand MasterAnswered on 23 Jun 2019Most singapore banks do not count top ups for their rewards. Topping up youtrip is like topping up our ezlink.0 comments1

BLBrian LeeLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 23 Jun 2019Well, there might not be miles or cashback, how about free installment perks? Well, if you use OCBC Cashflo, you can get free 3 month (>$100) or 6 months (>$1k) installment.
In addition, unsure true or not, you might still be able to get 0.5% to 1% rebates.0 comments0

Charmaine Ng, The Value Maximizer at @ Every Ma La Xiang Guo StallLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 16 Jun 2019Unfortunately, pretty much everyone who has responded so far is quite on point. There are no perks for topping up to a preloaded credit card and even if there are, most banks do not acknowledge topups as a criteria to earn rewards. Mostly expenditures do.0 comments0

Alex WongLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 14 Jun 2019All Singapore banks does not recognise top up transactions to Youtrip card, therefore thereâ€™s no reward from topping up to a prepaid wallet or account.0 comments0
